page.title: 04CHARNDON,A SMALL VILLAGE
page.content: The village once had many facilities. 3 years ago the village school closed. There used to be a pub called "The Roe Buck" but this is now a private house called "The Gables".Approaching the village,one sees a farm with two horses,an old storage barn and a grain silo. Nearby is a cottage which is timber framed and used to be thatched. There is only one street called "Main Street" with houses on either side. There is also "Middle Farm" with over 300 acres and "Valley Farm" where they had 2 tractors,1 pony,lambs and cattle. Half way up Main Street there is a small United Reformed Church and at the end is a recreation ground with swings and a community centre.
